Package au.csiro.pathling.library.io.source

Record Class DataSourceBuilder

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
au.csiro.pathling.library.io.source.DataSourceBuilder
Record Components:
context - the PathlingContext to use for creating the data sources
public record DataSourceBuilder(@Nonnull PathlingContext context) extends Record
A factory for creating various different data sources capable of preparing FHIR data for query.
Author:
Piotr Szul, John Grimes

  • Method Details

    • ndjson

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource ndjson(@Nullable String ndjsonDir)
      Creates a new data source from a directory containing NDJSON encoded FHIR resource data, with filenames containing the resource type the file contains, e.g. "Patient.ndjson" should contain only Patient resources.

      The filename can also optionally contain a qualifier after the resource type, to allow for resources of the same type to be organised into different files, e.g. "Observation.Chart.ndjson" and "Observation.Lab.ndjson".

      Parameters:
      ndjsonDir - the URI of directory containing NDJSON files
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • ndjson

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource ndjson(@Nullable String path, @Nullable String extension)
      Creates a new data source from a directory containing NDJSON encoded FHIR resource data, with filenames containing the resource type the file contains, e.g. "Patient.ndjson" should contain only Patient resources.

      The filename can also optionally contain a qualifier after the resource type, to allow for resources of the same type to be organised into different files, e.g. "Observation.Chart.ndjson" and "Observation.Lab.ndjson".

      A file extension is also provided, which overrides the default ".ndjson" extension and serves as a filter for the files to be included in the data source.

      Parameters:
      path - the URI of directory containing NDJSON files
      extension - the file extension to expect
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • ndjson

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource ndjson(@Nullable String path, @Nullable String extension, @Nullable Function<String,Set<String>> fileNameMapper)
      Creates a new data source from a directory containing NDJSON encoded FHIR resource data, with filenames determined by the provided function.

      A file extension is also provided, which overrides the default ".ndjson" extension and serves as a filter for the files to be included in the data source.

      Parameters:
      path - the URI of directory containing NDJSON files
      extension - the file extension to expect
      fileNameMapper - a function that maps a filename to a list of resource types
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • bundles

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource bundles(@Nullable String path, @Nullable Set<String> resourceTypes, @Nullable String mimeType)
      Creates a new data source from a directory containing FHIR Bundles. Takes an argument that specifies the resource types that should be extracted from the bundles and added to the data source.

      If the MIME type is "application/fhir+xml", then the bundles are expected to be in XML format, and the file extensions are expected to be ".xml". If the MIME type is "application/fhir+json", then the bundles are expected to be in JSON format, and the file extensions are expected to be ".json".

      Parameters:
      path - the URI of the directory containing the bundles
      resourceTypes - the resource types to extract from the bundles
      mimeType - the MIME type of the bundles
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • datasets

      @Nonnull public DatasetSource datasets()
      Creates a new data source from Spark datasets.
      Returns:
      a DatasetSource, which can then be populated with datasets that are mapped to the resource types that they contain, using the DatasetSource.dataset(java.lang.String, org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row>) method.

    • parquet

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource parquet(@Nullable String path)
      Creates a new data source form a directory containing Parquet-encoded FHIR resource data, with filenames representing the resource type the file/directory contains, e.g. 'Patient.parquet' should contain Patient resources.
      Parameters:
      path - the URI of the directory containing the Parquet files/directories
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • parquet

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource parquet(@Nullable String path, @Nullable Function<String,Set<String>> fileNameMapper)
      Creates a new data source from a directory containing Parquet-encoded FHIR resource data, with filenames determined by the provided function.
      Parameters:
      path - the URI of the directory containing the Parquet files/directories
      fileNameMapper - a function that maps a filename to a set of resource types
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • delta

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource delta(@Nullable String path)
      Creates a new data source from a Delta warehouse.
      Parameters:
      path - the location of the Delta warehouse
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • tables

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource tables()
      Creates a new data source from a tables registered within the catalog. The table names are assumed to be the same as the resource types they contain.
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • tables

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource tables(@Nullable String schema)
      Creates a new data source from a specified set of tables registered within the catalog. The table names are assumed to be the same as the resource types they contain. The schema from which the tables are read is specified.
      Parameters:
      schema - the schema from which the tables are read
      Returns:
      the new data source

    • bulk

      @Nonnull public QueryableDataSource bulk(@Nullable BulkExportClient client)
      Creates a new data source from a FHIR Bulk Data endpoint.
      Parameters:
      client - the configured BulkExportClient that specifies the endpoint and export parameters
      Returns:
      the new data source
